title: Warren backs Jumaane Williams in public advocate's race
text:
Elizabeth Warren, Massachusettes senator and top-tier presidential candidate, sent out a fundraising email Tuesday for Jumaane Williams. | Frank Franklin II/AP Photo Warren backs Jumaane Williams in public advocate's race

Sen. Elizabeth Warren is backing Jumaane Williams for reelection as public advocate.

The Massachusetts senator and top-tier presidential candidate sent out a fundraising email Tuesday for Williams, who is up against Republican City Council Member Joe Borelli in next week’s election.

Story Continued Below

“Jumaane has been an outstanding Public Advocate since his historic election in February, but his pro-Trump, special-interest-backed opponent is trying to undo all the progress we’ve made,” she wrote, asking supporters to chip in $30 for the public advocate’s campaign.

“In the coming days, I’m going to do everything I can to ensure Jumaane is re-elected — not just because he’s a dear friend, but because I believe in his ability to make New York City an even better place to live,” Warren added.

Williams was elected in a special election earlier this year to replace now-Attorney General Tish James, but must win again in the general election to keep the seat. The incumbent Democrat is expected to win handily in a city where registered Democrats outnumber Republicans by nearly seven to one.

Williams has not made an endorsement in the presidential race. He went to a rally Warren held in Washington Square Park last month, but told POLITICO he was between endorsing her or Sen. Bernie Sanders.

Borelli, the Republican nominee, is one of the few full-throated supporters of President Donald Trump in city politics, and is running on a platform of abolishing the largely powerless public advocate’s office unless it is given more authority.

“I’m not sure I’d want the support of someone who’s promising to punish the middle class with new taxes, but I suppose there may be one out of every 1,024 voters who disagree,” he said, in a swipe at Warren’s release of a DNA test finding she had a small percentage of Native American heritage.

In response to Warren’s attack on his support for Trump, he added: “It’s nice to see Elizabeth Warren has been watching me on Fox.”
description: Williams has not made an endorsement in the presidential race.
